title: Horrible lag issues, diagnostic information in post
body:
Sometimes, my ping which averages 77ms goes up to 255ms and hangs there for a couple hours.  I can't make it happen or fix it.  
Things that have failed:
1) Reboot PC
2) Reconnect to game
3) Reset router
4) Reset modem

I have had a friend over the last couple days and we have plenty of problem-free games.  But it's consistent with his laptop too when it happens to me.  Same amounts of lag.  

In another forum, I found the WinMTR tool.  When linked to host "192.64.170.1" (not sure if entirely correct) I have generated this report after 100 packets sent/received:

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |

|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |

|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|

|                             192.168.0.1 -    0 |  101 |  101 |    0 |    0 |    2 |    0 |

|                   No response from host -  100 |   21 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |

|          173-219-237-121.suddenlink.net -    0 |  101 |  101 |    7 |   12 |   27 |    8 |

|          173-219-235-248.suddenlink.net -    0 |  101 |  101 |   13 |   18 |   32 |   18 |

|        5-2-20.bear2.Phoenix1.Level3.net -    0 |  101 |  101 |   13 |   18 |   43 |   16 |

|                   No response from host -  100 |   21 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |

|                             4.14.45.214 -    0 |  101 |  101 |  151 |  208 |  267 |  162 |

|                          104.160.133.35 -    3 |   93 |   91 |    0 |  207 |  261 |  198 |

|          ae36-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -    0 |  101 |  101 |  192 |  250 |  309 |  206 |

|                          104.160.131.34 -    0 |  101 |  101 |  192 |  248 |  304 |  207 |

|                          104.160.131.44 -    2 |   97 |   96 |    0 |  248 |  298 |  205 |

|                         104.160.131.103 -    0 |  101 |  101 |  193 |  251 |  308 |  207 |

|                            10.23.246.10 -    2 |   97 |   96 |    0 |  251 |  309 |  203 |

|                            192.64.170.1 -   50 |   34 |   17 |    0 |  246 |  302 |  201 |

|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|

   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

I don't understand how to interpret this, but this is what I got boys.  

Please help!   Pleasepleaseplease.

Thank you!
-ScrotumJungle

replies.body:
It looks like your connection spikes when it hits Level 3's network, who are a backbone provider that your ISP partners with to get your connection to the League servers. Since you're not a direct customer of Level 3, you'll need to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 tech support and provide them this traceroute so they can investigate further. 

Let me know if you have any questions.
Thank you SO MUCH for this response!
